author: Staff Reporter
text:
There were tense moments at the Singanallur Bus Stand on Tuesday night as passengers of an omni bus insisted the driver of the bus to stop the vehicle at the Singanallur police station. They said they were being fleeced .

One of the passengers, Prasannakumar of Ganapathy, who boarded the bus to Tiruchi at Gandhipuram said that there were about 35 passengers in the vehicle. They were asked to pay Rs. 450 per seat instead of Rs. 150 that the same operator collected on regular days. “The operator escalated the fare due to festival demand,” he said.

After a heated argument the bus was made to stop at the police station where the passengers urged the police to initiate legal action against the operator.

Passengers claimed that the police refused to register a case. And when they emerged from the police station, the bus had driven off.

The police claimed the passengers were yet to lodge a written complaint against the operator. Police sources also said that the issue would be referred to the transport department.

They said they were being fleeced by the operator and asked to pay

Rs. 450 per seat
title: Passengers force omni bus to stop at police station
